title: UK’s first electric forecourt opens in Essex
lead: The project enables EV drivers to charge for a range of 200 miles in 20 minutes

title: Ovo’s last resort supply payment claim of £45k approved by Ofgem
lead: The claim covers the costs incurred in acting as supplier of last resort to domestic gas customers of former supplier Cardiff Energy Supply Limited

title: Boris Johnson targets 68% emissions cut: Industry responds
lead: The Prime Minister vowed to cut emissions by 68% by 2030 based on 1990 levels – but what does the industry think?

title: Yorkshire Water uses AI and IoT to reduce wastewater pollution
lead: It has teamed up with the University of Sheffield and Siemens Digital Industries to develop an innovative blockage predictor solution, which identifies problems in the network quickly

title: 2020 is on track to become ‘one of the three hottest years on record’
lead: The warmest six years on record have all occured since 2015, according to the World Meteorological Organisation’s new report

title: Minesto injects first tidal energy into the Faroe Islands’ grid
lead: The marine energy developer has now switched on its 100kW grid-connected tidal kite system in the islands

title: SSE Business Energy is sponsoring Net Zero Leaders at TELCA 2020 – and here’s the shortlist…
lead: This year, our industry-recognised awards show is taking place online on the 11th of December

title: Helping you find the right electricity supplier for your business
lead: It’s commonplace for businesses to switch electricity suppliers to help them save money and achieve greater sustainability. Yet finding the right one can seem daunting. This becomes more difficult if you’re looking to get more from your energy usage or putting your electricity contract out to tender for the first time.

title: New project to help catalyse affordable green housing finance in India
lead: Green buildings are expected to help save more than 20% on energy and water consumption compared to typical buildings

title: Four people die after explosion at sewage plant near Bristol
lead: Avon and Somerset Police said three Wessex Water employees and one contractor were killed
